answers.answer: Protein is NOT a good thing to have in your urine, especially that early on. That can be a sign of preeclampsia which can cause extreme complications during your pregnancy. BH contractions aren't supposed to be painful, maybe uncomfortable, but until you get closer to delivering, they shouldn't become painful. You need to get in contact with your doctor about what all of this means and what they'll do to help, but definitely do not let this go unnoticed!

the anaemia i've had in pregnancy twice and was given iron tablets...had no other problems with those pregnancies. e coli i don't know about, as Kimberlee said i'd ask my dr what the possible implications are.

it's probably the tablets for the e coli causing that. iron tablets just make it difficult to poop. as long as you kept them down for half an hour, they will be in your system so don't worry ( easier said than done i know )

question: Hi  ladies i have  jst ahd my results bk from my urine and blood samples and iv jst found out  i  am  anemic and i  also have  e-coli is this something to b worried about im   jst over 28 wks pregnant. when i went to the midwife  tuesday she found 4 +++ in my urine sample alone which  were sugar , protien nitrate and sumthin else which i cant remember sorry. i  had told my midwife previous to this that i hadnt been feeling to great and i  had been having the runs on  and off  wen eva and id been feeling really sick again not to mention having   slight painful contractions,  which i  jst tryed to ignor and pass off as braxton hicks. cos im not sure if thats all they  are! and help on that would b  great. iv now gotta go  bk and c my doctor now and find out if there are anymore results waiting for me and collect  sum perscriptions so ill let u no how i get on  later . any help and advise would b  appreciated many thanks :)
